page.title: 17MR. GREENLEAVES (1)
page.content: Mr. Greenleaves, at 84, has lived in Frodsham for over half his life. He was born and lived in Ashley Gardens, the middle child of five. His father was an insurance collector calling at Frodsham, Helsby, Kingsley, Dutton and Sutton Weaver on foot. His mother stayed at home to care for the family. Their home comprised a kitchen and three bedrooms upstairs. The W.C. was in the yard. He attended school behind the Church Hall and after 18 months (in standard II) he was one of 8 chosen to eventually sit the 11+. Immediately moved to St.III to work harder. The headteacher took the scholarship for extra training. No talking permitted in class, the punishment being the cane _not often used but it "was there". In St.VI the poor readers spent their lunchtime being helped by more able pupils.
